title: Document how to use difftastic with Fossil
body: I don't use Git for almost all of my own tools, but I still use difftastic with my Fossil repositories. Here's how.

title: Tweak documentation for adding a parser
body:
Thanks a lot for the extensive documentation, this made it pretty easy to add two new parsers for languages I care about.

I noticed two small things in the documentation; updating it to reflect this. See commit messages for details.

title: doc: extend description of mercurial configuration
body:
Mention that command-line arguments can be added, and that `hg dft` supports all arguments `hg diff` does.
Seeing the `hg dft` incantation below, it took me a moment to realise that `hg dft` will then support comparing revisions.

Perhaps a better change would be to tweak the description of the `hg log -p` section: any two revisions can be compared like this, not just the working directory to the latest revision checked out.

title: doc: update mercurial configuration example
body: The `--missing-as-empty` option has been removed in version 0.46.

title: Add Solidity support
body: This PR adds Solidity support to difftastic, thanks to [tree-sitter-solidity](https://github.com/JoranHonig/tree-sitter-solidity)

title: Recognize the Arduino extension as C++
Relax version dependencies
body:
For dependencies we're pinning for Rust 1.57 compatibility, specify the range of versions allowed rather than just pinning to the maximum version allowed.

This makes it easier for Linux distribution packaging, where a different version might already be packaged.

title: Update tree-sitter-scala
body: Tree-sitter-scala has had a lot of updates recently to improve support for Scala 3. This PR updates tree-sitter-scala to that latest version.

title: Check arguments passed from Git for `/dev/null`
body: This fixes https://github.com/Wilfred/difftastic/issues/296.

title: Fix file content type detection for small gzipped files
body:
This PR fixes a case where small gzipped files are incorrectly interpreted is UTF-16 strings. See the added test case for explanation. I encountered this issue in one of my employers private repos.

I admit the fix isn't pretty. Fixing #433 seems to have made the content type detection too complicated. I tried to reproduce #433 in 2e7c90c472fbfe9df93d2c0e63817ba7f8491deb but I wasn't able to do that. However I decided to be on the safe side and not revert those changes.

In the long run it would probably be beneficial to consider all supported file types (as defined in `guess_language.rs`) to be plain text and for other files trust the content type check from `tree_magic`. 

I can create a new PR to implement that if the maintainers think it is a good idea.

title: Update linguist-vendored attribute
body:
https://github.com/github/linguist/blob/master/docs/overrides.md#vendored-code
Use `**` instead of `*` to exclude nested files.

title: [translation] Adjust content of Chinese translation
body:
* Add **spaces** between Chinese and English (_or code, digits and link_) according to Chinese reading habits
* Adjust the **wording** to make the reading more fluent and clear while reducing the use of inappropriate words (_reduce words that are customarily used less often too_)
* Regulate **punctuation usage** accordance with [the relevant standards on punctuation usage in Chinese](http://www.moe.gov.cn/jyb_sjzl/ziliao/A19/201001/W020190128580990138234.pdf) and Chinese usage conventions
* Update the number of supported languages

Welcome any reasonable opinions on this PR. 

----

* 根据中文阅读习惯与阅读体验，在中英文（或中文与数字、行内代码、链接）间增加**空格**
* 进行**措辞**调整，以在减少不当用词的基础上使阅读更流畅、清晰（同时减少一些使用较少的词语）
* 按照 [《标点符号用法》](http://www.moe.gov.cn/jyb_sjzl/ziliao/A19/201001/W020190128580990138234.pdf) 和使用惯例规范**标点符号使用**
* 更新支持的语言的数量

欢迎对此拉取请求提出任何合理的意见。

title: Add `cargo binstall` metadata
body:
Right now `cargo binstall` cannot find the pre-compiled `difftastic` assets:

```
~
❯ cargo binstall difftastic
 INFO resolve: Resolving package: 'difftastic'
 WARN resolve: The package will be installed from source (with cargo)
Do you wish to continue? yes/[no]
? no
 WARN Installation cancelled

~ took 18s
❯ cargo binstall difftastic --pkg-url="{ repo }/releases/download/{ version }/difft-{ target }.{ archive-format }"
 INFO resolve: Resolving package: 'difftastic'
 WARN resolve: The package will be downloaded from github.com
 INFO resolve: This will install the following binaries:
 INFO resolve:   - difft (difft -> /home/michel/.cargo/bin/difft-v0.38.0)
 INFO resolve: And create (or update) the following symlinks:
 INFO resolve:   - difft (/home/michel/.cargo/bin/difft -> difft-v0.38.0)
Do you wish to continue? yes/[no]
? yes
 INFO install: Installing binaries...
 INFO Done in 9.277840305s
```

Adding this `pkg-url` override to `Cargo.toml` allows `binstall` to find the pre-compiled archives:

```
~
❯ cargo binstall --manifest-path ~/src/github/Wilfred/difftastic/Cargo.toml difftastic
 INFO resolve: Resolving package: 'difftastic'
 INFO resolve: difftastic v0.38.0 is already installed, use --force to override
 INFO Done in 5.327886ms

~
❯ cargo binstall --manifest-path ~/src/github/Wilfred/difftastic/Cargo.toml difftastic --force
 INFO resolve: Resolving package: 'difftastic'
 WARN resolve: The package will be downloaded from github.com
 INFO resolve: This will install the following binaries:
 INFO resolve:   - difft (difft -> /home/michel/.cargo/bin/difft-v0.38.0)
 INFO resolve: And create (or update) the following symlinks:
 INFO resolve:   - difft (/home/michel/.cargo/bin/difft -> difft-v0.38.0)
Do you wish to continue? yes/[no]
? yes
 INFO install: Installing binaries...
 INFO Done in 5.484314255s
```

Signed-off-by: Michel Alexandre Salim <michel@michel-slm.name>

title: Sync tree-sitter-swift with upstream
body:
Fixes #277

The upstream parser has added new support for a variety of constructs, including better tracking for `await`. Query load time has also been substantially improved by simplifying the rules that match patterns.

Synced with the current latest commit at `alex-pinkus/tree-sitter-swift`: [a828c40ee9881e8705182c23a829b38a2199a00d](https://github.com/alex-pinkus/tree-sitter-swift/tree/a828c40ee9881e8705182c23a829b38a2199a00d).

title: 20 known languages => 30
body:
Manual pages at https://difftastic.wilfred.me.uk/ lists more than 30 languages and reports "It supports over 30 programming languages and when it works, it's fantastic.".
The chances are you forgot to update the README.md file.

title: Update README-zh-CN.md
body:
fix image path

The previous version can not show image properly because of the incorrect path.

title: Some optimizations
body:
First, enable thin-LTO. This brings ~5% speedup.

Before:

```text
 Performance counter stats for 'cargo run --release -- sample_files/slow_before.rs sample_files/slow_after.rs':

          1,033.66 msec task-clock:u              #    0.999 CPUs utilized          
                 0      context-switches:u        #    0.000 /sec                   
                 0      cpu-migrations:u          #    0.000 /sec                   
             6,127      page-faults:u             #    5.927 K/sec                  
     3,992,966,896      cycles:u                  #    3.863 GHz                    
       295,590,268      stalled-cycles-frontend:u #    7.40% frontend cycles idle   
     1,229,153,356      stalled-cycles-backend:u  #   30.78% backend cycles idle    
     4,948,279,348      instructions:u            #    1.24  insn per cycle         
                                                  #    0.25  stalled cycles per insn
       975,024,920      branches:u                #  943.275 M/sec                  
        20,612,498      branch-misses:u           #    2.11% of all branches        

       1.034353300 seconds time elapsed

       0.973504000 seconds user
       0.059968000 seconds sys
```

After:

```text
 Performance counter stats for 'cargo run --release -- sample_files/slow_before.rs sample_files/slow_after.rs':

            996.05 msec task-clock:u              #    0.998 CPUs utilized          
                 0      context-switches:u        #    0.000 /sec                   
                 0      cpu-migrations:u          #    0.000 /sec                   
             6,116      page-faults:u             #    6.140 K/sec                  
     3,926,308,401      cycles:u                  #    3.942 GHz                    
       263,648,312      stalled-cycles-frontend:u #    6.71% frontend cycles idle   
     1,349,401,185      stalled-cycles-backend:u  #   34.37% backend cycles idle    
     4,859,980,027      instructions:u            #    1.24  insn per cycle         
                                                  #    0.28  stalled cycles per insn
       920,523,681      branches:u                #  924.177 M/sec                  
        19,978,054      branch-misses:u           #    2.17% of all branches        

       0.998478582 seconds time elapsed

       0.932282000 seconds user
       0.063171000 seconds sys
```

The numbers of instructions are relatively stable.

I also measured them using hyperfine.

Before:

```console
$ hyperfine --warmup=3 'cargo run --release -- sample_files/slow_before.rs sample_files/slow_after.rs'
Benchmark 1: cargo run --release -- sample_files/slow_before.rs sample_files/slow_after.rs
  Time (mean ± σ):      1.046 s ±  0.051 s    [User: 0.993 s, System: 0.052 s]
  Range (min … max):    1.001 s …  1.141 s    10 runs
```

After:

```console
$ hyperfine --warmup=3 'cargo run --release -- sample_files/slow_before.rs sample_files/slow_after.rs'
Benchmark 1: cargo run --release -- sample_files/slow_before.rs sample_files/slow_after.rs
  Time (mean ± σ):     986.4 ms ±  15.3 ms    [User: 930.6 ms, System: 54.3 ms]
  Range (min … max):   971.3 ms … 1024.4 ms    10 runs
```

title: add a link to change the language version
body: Hi, Wilfred! I add a line in the introduction part of the manual to provide the link to change the language version.

## Summary
I translate the manual into zh-CN.
## How it was tested?
I follow the instruction of how to build the manual locally, and webstie turns out work properly.

title: Add Hare support
body: https://harelang.org

title: Add support for QML
body:
QML is a UI language, and its syntax is basically JSON-like structure + JavaScript. The tree-sitter parser is named after the upstream grammar file qmljs.g, but the canonical language name is QML. So I choose Qml as the Language enum.
    
https://doc.qt.io/qt-6/qmlapplications.html

title: Unset LC_ALL and LC_COLLATE to stabilize regression test output
body: I set LC_COLLATE=C in ~/.profile, which appears to change the glob order. LC_ALL would also affect that, so let's unset both.

title: Fix help-value for "--syntax-highlight" argument.
body: "ON" and "OFF" in uppercase are not accepted. Print help in lowercase to match accepted values.

title: chinese translation of README.md
body:
I add the chinese translation of README.md, and then add a Translation part on the original README.md.
All of the relative references work well.

title: Add arm64 releases for Linux and macOS
body: This adds `aarch64` (arm64) releases for both Linux and macOS.

title: Fix: Can't build on Windows in a locale whose default encoding is not UTF-8
body:
Fix https://github.com/Wilfred/difftastic/issues/342 by adding `/utf-8` flag to cl.exe.

Ref. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build/reference/utf-8-set-source-and-executable-character-sets-to-utf-8?view=msvc-170

title: Use `terminal_size` crate instead of `term_size` crate
body:
`term_size` crate has stopped maintenance 2 years ago.

> This crate is no longer maintained. It works fine, but the maintainers don't have time and > willingness to work on it or review future PRs anymore.
>
> Consider using [terminal_size](https://github.com/eminence/terminal-size/) instead.

https://github.com/clap-rs/term_size-rs#maintenance-status

This PR replaces the dependency with [`terminal-size`](https://github.com/eminence/terminal-size/) crate which is recommended by `term_size` crate maintainer and well maintained.

title: updates to support building on windows
body:
closes #253 thanks to @petrochenkov's fix mentioned there.

I just switched the order of a few lines. I did not change any in the build.rs.
The rust-toolchain.toml had to be updated to support this crate which won't compile in 1.56.1 any longer.
```
Caused by:
  package `os_str_bytes v6.2.0` cannot be built because it requires rustc 1.57.0 or newer, while the currently active rustc version is 1.56.1
```

title: feat: Add HTML parser
body: Adding an HTML parser based on [tree-sitter/tree-sitter-html](/tree-sitter/tree-sitter-html). Examples: Some notes: * It doesn't re-parse interior CSS or JS, so any change will diff as a full replacement. * I configured sliders to be false. I don't really know what this does. * Someone should maybe double check the `atom_nodes` and `delimiter_tokens`. I tried to match how some of the existing ones are configured, but I also don't really know what this does. * I added a note about sliders.rs to adding_a_parser.md as I couldn't compile without configuring a match leg for the enum value. This could probably be expanded as (again... 😄) I don't know what it does exactly.

title: feat: Improve binary content guess
body:
Signed-off-by: Xuanwo <github@xuanwo.io>

Fix #278 

Introduce `tree_magic_mini` to read magic bytes so that we can guess file media type more accurately and extensible.

In this PR, I add checks for

- pdf
- all image types
- all audio types
- all video types
- all font types

title: Add Swift support
body: Adds support for Swift. [tree-sitter-swift does not include `parser.c` in its repository](https://github.com/alex-pinkus/tree-sitter-swift#where-is-your-parserc), so I generated the `parser.c` using `tree-sitter-cli` and checked that in.

title: simplify creation of atom nodes & delimiter tokens
body: While I was in tree_sitter_parser for #205 I noticed that a bunch of parsers were collecting a vec to a vec (`vec![("(", ")"].into_iter().collect::<Vec<(&'static str, &'static str)>>()`, so I removed the into_iter().collect(). As long as I was doing that, I also changed the `vec!["hashset"].into_iter().collect()` into `["hashset"].into()` for brevity. Thanks!

body: Thanks!

title: Add Janet support
body:
This PR is an attempt to add support for the [Janet programming language](https://janet-lang.org/), a language with a lisp-ish / clojure-ish syntax.

In Janet, mutable collections are distinguished from immutable ones via a leading `@`.  In the tree-sitter grammar used in this PR, `@{`, `@(`, and `@[` are tokens indicating opening delimiters.  I hope the following code in `src/tree_sitter_parser.rs` was appropriate:
```
delimiter_tokens: (vec![("@{", "}"), ("@(", ")"), ("@[", "]"),
                        ("{", "}"), ("(", ")"), ("[", "]")])
```
